alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 2:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 830 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 AM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Water levels have jumped by 3 feet according to the river gauge along the Little Colorado River in Holbrook. Levels are still rising there and areas downstream. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Mesa Wash, McDonald Canyon, Little Colorado River, Porter Tank Draw, Silver Creek, Fivemile Wash, Carr Lake Draw, Washboard Wash, Joseph City Wash, Sevenmile Draw, Manila Wash, Puerco River and Leroux Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Holbrook, Woodruff, Joseph City and Manila. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 268 and 276...and between mile markers 280 and 287. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 287. State Route 77 between mile markers 387 and 388. Highway 180 between mile markers 308 and 312. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
